content.description:
A tricky start on small holds leads to a big flake and the ledge - finish directly up to the anchors.

An independent unbolted line between 3rd Base and Self Satisfaction, if you're there why not?

Clip the first bolt and step down onto a small ledge on the arete. A few small hold moves lead to the second bolt. From here you can sidle up onto the ledge on the right above all things - clipping bolt 3 in an exposed position, now either tackle the bulge above directly or step back around to the left and make some moves to clip the final bolt and the top.
Easy flakes past three bolts to a ledge, then lieback the crux flake on the right to the top clipping a shared bolt.
content.protection: Four bolts - final bolt is shared with route to the right.
content.location: Center bolted route. Shares chain anchors with the other routes.

content.description:
Fairly varied climb. Begins as an offwidth (which can be laybacked), widens to an optional chimney or alternative easy slabby face, then finishes off with short bouldery topout of a ledge (the crux... unless you really hate offwidths/liebacking).

A mini step across above the bouldery finish. Optionally you can cut out the last 2 bolts and lower prematurely from the anchors off the 10d route to the right from the ledge.

It's highly suggested you clip the final bolt in addition to the chains to avoid an undesireable swing if setting up a TR. This bolt can be safely accessed from the top
content.location: Located in the always shady North side of the phallus tower. Of the North side, there are 3-4 bolted routes (established alternate start). This is the middle of the three and the most obvious line that starts with an offwidth.

content.description: Slab route that bends right up shared anchor.
content.location: Left side of the south face.
